scenarios.name: E2E - Create Formula Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
scenarios.description: This scenario validates the complete end-to-end user journey for creating a new metric using the Formula Builder, setting a Weekly cadence, adding it to the dashboard, and configuring a 4-level Custom target.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the correct company from the list.
Step 19: Navigate to the Metrics Page by clicking 'Metrics' in the navigation menu.
Step 20: Click the 'Add Metric' button to initiate metric creation.
Step 21: Enter the metric name in the 'Name' input field.
Step 22: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 24: In the Formula Builder, search for and select the first metric.
Step 25: Click on the '+' operator button.
Step 26: Search for and select the second metric.
Step 28: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 14A: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 14B: Select a day of the week from the 'Resets On' dropdown that appears.
Step 29: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
STEP 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
STEP 19: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
STEP 21: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
STEP 22: Click the metric in the left panel to move it to the right panel.
STEP 23: Click the 'Save' button in the modal to add the KPI to the dashboard.
STEP 25: Locate the correct metric card for the newly added metric on the dashboard.
STEP 26: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
STEP 27: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown menu.
STEP 29: Click the 'Edit' option in the dropdown menu.
STEP 31: Select the 'Target' tab on the Edit page.
Step 32A.1: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
Step 32A.3: Enter the Level 1 target value.
Step 32A.4: Enter the Level 2 target value.
Step 32A.5: Enter the Level 3 target value.
Step 32A.6: Enter the Level 4 target value.
STEP 33: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
STEP 35: Verify the metric card on the dashboard now displays the custom target visual indicators.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and navigates to the Metrics page.
A new metric is created with a formula combining two existing metrics.
The metric's cadence is set to 'Weekly' and the 'Resets On' day is saved correctly.
The new metric is successfully added as a KPI to 'My Dashboard'.
The metric's target is successfully configured with four descending 'Custom' target values.
The metric card on the dashboard correctly visualizes the configured custom target levels.
test_data_requirements: A valid user account with login credentials.
At least two existing 'Number' format metrics to be used in the formula (e.g., 'Metric A', 'Metric B').
Metric_Name: A unique name for the new metric.
First_Metric: Name of the first existing metric.
Second_Metric: Name of the second existing metric.

scenarios.name: E2E - Create Formula Metric with Monthly Cadence and Time-Based Target
scenarios.description: This scenario validates the successful creation of a formula-based metric with a Monthly cadence, adding it to the dashboard, and configuring a Time-Based target with a start and end value.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the correct company from the list.
Step 19: Navigate to the Metrics Page by clicking 'Metrics' in the navigation menu.
Step 20: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 21: Enter a unique metric name.
Step 22: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 24: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
Step 25: Click on the '*' operator button.
Step 26: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
Step 28: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 14A: Select 'Monthly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 29: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
STEP 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
STEP 19: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon.
STEP 21: Locate the new metric in the available metrics list.
STEP 22: Click the metric to add it to the dashboard KPIs.
STEP 23: Click 'Save' in the modal.
STEP 25: Locate the newly added metric card on the dashboard.
STEP 26: Hover over the card to show the three-dot menu.
STEP 27: Click the three-dot menu.
STEP 29: Click the 'Edit' option.
STEP 31: Select the 'Target' tab.
Step 32B.1: Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
Step 32B.3: Enter the 'Start' value.
Step 32B.4: Enter the 'Target' value.
STEP 33: Click the 'Save' button.
STEP 35: Verify the metric card on the dashboard displays the Time-Based target progress indicator, start value, and target value.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully creates a new metric using a multiplication formula.
The metric's cadence is correctly set to 'Monthly'. The 'Resets On' field should not be visible.
The new metric is successfully added to 'My Dashboard'.
The metric's target is successfully configured as 'Time-Based' with a start and target value.
The metric card on the dashboard correctly visualizes the configured Time-Based target.
test_data_requirements: A valid user account with login credentials.
Metric_Name: A unique name for the new metric.
First_Metric: Name of an existing metric.
Second_Metric: Name of another existing metric.
Time_Based_Target_Value: A numeric target value greater than the start value (e.g., 500).

scenarios.name: E2E - Create Metric from Existing Metric with Quarterly Cadence
scenarios.description: This scenario validates the alternative path where a new metric is created by referencing a single existing metric, instead of using the Formula Builder. It uses a Quarterly cadence and configures a Time-Based target.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the correct company from the list.
Step 19: Navigate to the Metrics Page.
Step 20: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 21: Enter a unique metric name.
Step 22: Select 'Metric' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 11-ALT: Search for and select an existing metric from the metric search/dropdown field.
Step 14A: Select 'Quarterly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 29: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
STEP 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
STEP 19: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon.
STEP 21: Locate the new metric in the available metrics list.
STEP 22: Click the metric to add it to the dashboard KPIs.
STEP 23: Click 'Save' in the modal.
STEP 25: Locate the newly added metric card on the dashboard.
STEP 26: Hover over the card to show the three-dot menu.
STEP 27: Click the three-dot menu.
STEP 29: Click the 'Edit' option.
STEP 31: Select the 'Target' tab.
Step 32B.1: Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
Step 32B.3: Enter the 'Start' value.
Step 32B.4: Enter the 'Target' value.
STEP 33: Click the 'Save' button.
STEP 35: Verify the metric card on the dashboard displays the Time-Based target.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully creates a new metric by selecting an existing metric as its value source.
The metric's cadence is correctly set to 'Quarterly'.
The new metric is successfully added to 'My Dashboard'.
A 'Time-Based' target is successfully configured and saved for the metric.
The metric card on the dashboard correctly reflects the saved Time-Based target configuration.
test_data_requirements: A valid user account with login credentials.
At least one existing 'Number' format metric to select.
Metric_Name: A unique name for the new metric.
Metric_To_Select: The name of the existing metric to use as the source.

dependencies: A valid, active user account with permissions to create metrics and edit dashboards.
The application environment at the specified base_url must be available and stable.
For formula-based scenarios, at least two pre-existing metrics with numeric data must be available in the system.
For 'Value Source: Metric' scenarios, at least one pre-existing metric must be available.
edge_cases: Successfully creating a formula metric using the '/' (Division) operator.
Successfully setting a 'Weekly' cadence where 'Resets On' is 'Sunday'.
Successfully configuring a 'Time-Based' target where the Start and Target values are the same.
Successfully creating a metric with a name that includes numbers and special characters like hyphens.

test_data.second_metric: [Name of second metric to use in formula]
